headline.main: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Set Date for Next Debate
headline.print_headline: Democratic Accord; Clinton and Sanders Agree to Debate on April 14 at a Site in Brooklyn

docs.snippet: After weeks of bickering, Hillary Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders have agreed to meet for a debate on April 14 in Brooklyn, less than a week before New Yorkers head to the polls for the critical April 19 primary....
docs.abstract: After weeks of bickering, Hillary Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders have agreed to meet for a debate on April 14 in Brooklyn, less than a week before New Yorkers head to the polls for the critical April 19 primary.

headline.main: Conservative Group Launches Ad Buy for Wisconsin's Johnson

docs.snippet: The national conservative group funded by Charles and David Koch is launching a $1.1 million television ad campaign in Wisconsin in support of Republican Sen. Ron Johnson as he faces a tough re-election fight....

docs.snippet: TERMINE--Charles M., M.D., passed away on March 30, 2016 of Port St. Lucie, FL. (formerly of Manhasset). Beloved husband of Eleanor Termine. Loving father of Regina Termine of Albertson, NY and Michael C. Termine of Menifee, CA. Cherished grandfat...
docs.lead_paragraph: TERMINE--Charles M., M.D., passed away on March 30, 2016 of Port St. Lucie, FL. (formerly of Manhasset). Beloved husband of Eleanor Termine. Loving father of Regina Termine of Albertson, NY and Michael C. Termine of Menifee, CA. Cherished grandfather of two. Visitation will be held at Fairchild Funeral Chapel, 1570 Northern Blvd., Manhasset on Tuesday from 3-5pm and 7-9pm. Funeral Mass Wednesday, 10am at St. Mary's Church, Manhasset. Interment St. John's Cemetery, Middle Village.

docs.snippet: LENNIGER--Sr. Barbara. A Dominican Sister of Sparkill since 1951, Sr. Barbara was teacher, administrator (1953- 85) and the founder and Executive Director of Thorpe Family Residence and Park Avenue Thorpe. Visitation: Wednesday, April 6, 3:30- 8:0...
docs.lead_paragraph:
LENNIGER--Sr. Barbara.

A Dominican Sister of Sparkill since 1951, Sr. Barbara was teacher, administrator (1953- 85) and the founder and Executive Director of Thorpe Family Residence and Park Avenue Thorpe. Visitation: Wednesday, April 6, 3:30- 8:00pm. Mass Thursday, April 7 at 10:30am (Dominican Convent, 175 Rte. 340, Sparkill, NY). In lieu of flowers, donations to Dominican Sisters, Sr. Mary Murray, President.

docs.snippet: JUREW--Patricia A. (nee Wolf), 87, died peacefully April 4, 2016. Bloomfield High School, 1947, Katharine Gibbs, 1949. Career: US State Dept., London; NY Times; US Golf Association. Married in 1955 to Wm. Jurew, who predeceased her in 1987. Surviv...
docs.lead_paragraph: JUREW--Patricia A. (nee Wolf), 87, died peacefully April 4, 2016. Bloomfield High School, 1947, Katharine Gibbs, 1949. Career: US State Dept., London; NY Times; US Golf Association. Married in 1955 to Wm. Jurew, who predeceased her in 1987. Survived by Lee Ann, Joe, Alex, Callie Puleo; and Peter, Erin, Anna Vincent Jurew.

docs.snippet: BINGHAM--Arthur Walker III, died peacefully at home on April 1, 2016, in his 88th year. He was born in New York City and attended The Buckley School, St. Paul's School, Harvard College and Harvard Law School. He served as a naval officer during th...
docs.lead_paragraph:
BINGHAM--Arthur Walker III,

died peacefully at home on April 1, 2016, in his 88th year. He was born in New York City and attended The Buckley School, St. Paul's School, Harvard College and Harvard Law School. He served as a naval officer during the Korean War and held the rank of Lieutenant. After graduating Law School, he was an attorney at Millbank Tweed, Hadley & McCloy, the General Attorney for Abex Corporation, and the Chairman of Boorum & Pease Company. He led an active life participating in many organizations including, at various times, President of the Church Club of New York, Trustee of Fort Ticonderoga, Commander of Knights Templar, Master of Holland Lodge, a Vestryman of St. James Church, Secretary of the National Institute of Social Sciences, and a Lieutenant Governor of the Society of Colonial Wars. He was passionate about history and collected a library of antique medicinal advertising, Patent Medicines and preparations, about which he published the "Snake Oil Syndrome," an illustrated history of Patent Medicine advertising. He is survived by his beloved wife, Nicolette Pathy, his daughter Nicole P. Bingham, his sons Arthur W. Bingham and Alexander D. Bingham, and three grandchildren. A funeral service celebrating his life will be held at the Church of the Epiphany, 1393 York Avenue, New York City, on April 18th at 4pm. In lieu of flowers, contributions in his honor may be made to St. Paul's School, 325 Pleasant Street, Concord, NH or The Buckley School, 113 East 73rd Street, NYC.

docs.snippet: KETTANEH--Mary. died peacefully at home surrounded by family and friends, April 3, 2016, aged 102 years. She is survived by her beloved children Joyce Kettaneh Longworth, Lorna Kettaneh, and Edward Kettaneh. She was predeceased by her husband Fran...
docs.lead_paragraph:
KETTANEH--Mary.

died peacefully at home surrounded by family and friends, April 3, 2016, aged 102 years. She is survived by her beloved children Joyce Kettaneh Longworth, Lorna Kettaneh, and Edward Kettaneh. She was predeceased by her husband Francis Kettaneh, and her son Anthony Kettaneh. She leaves behind seven beloved granddaughters and 13 great-grandchildren. Mary Shoucair Kettaneh was born in 1913 in Beirut, Lebanon to the late Farid Shoucair and Adele (Chiha) Shoucair. She married Francis Kettaneh in 1934. During the Second World War she traveled to New York City where she and her husband soon made their home. In addition to adoring and caring for her family, she volunteered wholeheartedly for the New York Metropolitan Committee for UNICEF. In 1985 the French Government honored her as a Chevalier de l'Ordre des Arts et des Lettres. She lived life with gusto, generosity, and elegance. A memorial service celebrating her life will be offered at a future date. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made in Mary's honor to the United States Fund for UNICEF at: unicefusa.org or checks may be mailed to 125 Maiden Lane, NY, NY 10038.

docs.snippet: MORDFIN--Renee. UJA-Federation of New York mourns the passing of Renee Mordfin, who leaves behind a loving family that will carry on a tradition of exceptional Jewish philanthropy. We extend our heartfelt condolences to Renee's beloved husband, Je...
docs.lead_paragraph:
MORDFIN--Renee.

UJA-Federation of New York mourns the passing of Renee Mordfin, who leaves behind a loving family that will carry on a tradition of exceptional Jewish philanthropy. We extend our heartfelt condolences to Renee's beloved husband, Jerry; her children, Stuart (Lily), Susan Hodder (Kane), and Rose Appel (Seth); her grandchildren; and the entire family. Alisa R. Doctoroff, President; Linda Mirels, Chair of the Board; Eric S. Goldstein, CEO
